alfredsnippet.snippet:
(cont'd)

"This is not an isolated phenomenon. It is becoming all too common, especially in the field of theoretical physics and cosmology, both heavily dependent upon abstract mathematical models which are increasingly seen as a substitute for empirical investigation of the real world. For every conscious peddler of mysticism in this field, there are a hundred conscientious scientists, who would be horrified to be identified with such obscurantism."

- Reason in Revolt: Marxism and Modern Science, Alan Woods and Ted Grant
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - The Injection of Mysticism and Religion Into Science - Part 2
